result.execSummary:
The defendant Bridget R Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution claimed in this matter, to be held open for 30 days. 
Requests are to be made available to counsel to contest amount.

Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
No contact with any of the victims in this matter: J.F. and M.H. except to write a letter of apology to each individual.

Obtain counseling and other assessments as recommended by the agent. 
Submit to a DNA sample.

timeConds.notes:
Huber granted for work, school or any other reason the Sheriff will allow. 
Second half may be served on Electronic Monitoringif defendant qualifies for the program and up to the Sheriff. 
60 days to start the sentence, report to jail today for start time.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bridget R Lee

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bridget R Lee in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today: 15CF193 & 15CM501

1:35 pm. Court calls case.
Case is before the Court on a motion to amend sentence.
Atty Kryshak gives statements.
Atty Cousins indicates that victims have been notified on 15CF193. 

BY THE COURT:
Court does not allow reduced time on sentence for 15CF193.
Court allows 60 days to commence sentence.
Defendant to report today to the jail to receive start date.

15CM501
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Atty Cousins states plea agreement.
Attorney Kryshak concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Ct 1: NO CONTEST
Ct 2: NO CONTEST

Atty Cousins strikes the repeater allegations.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders the repeater language stricken on the complaint.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Kryshak.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Ct 1 & Ct 2.  
Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements.

BY THE COURT:
Ct 1: 
20 months probation concurrent to any probation already serving
Withheld sentence 45 days jail
Pay DNA surcharge in Ct 1 only

Ct 2:
Withheld sentence 90 days jail concurrent to count 1
20 months probation concurrent to count 1
Write a letter of apology to the agents involved in this case within 30 days
Comply with AODA assessment sing releases of information
Maintain absolute sobriety
Participate in any assessment counseling deemed appropriate by the agent 
Pay costs and surcharges
Huber priviledges for work/school and counseling and any other reason that the Sheriff will allow
Can serve second 45 days jail sentence with home monitoring if she qualifies
to Amend Sentence
fax letter from the DOC dated 12/18/15 in re:  request the Court to allow Ms Lee to either complete inpatient programming in lieu of jail or postpone the state date of her jail term
fax letter from the DOC dated 12/18/15 in re:  request the Court to allow Ms Lee to either complete inpatient programming in lieu of jail or postpone the state date of her jail term
/s/ TBE 12/15/15 - victim witness office has determined there is zero restitution due
D. Kaminski
C. Brundage
K. Mumper
G. Zalewski
from Defendant

Defendant Bridget R Lee in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CF-193 and 15CF-281.

1:37 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Constable states appearances.

State moves to dismiss and read in Count 1 in 15CF-281 and moves to dismiss and read in Count 1 in 15CF-193
Defendant will plead to counts 2 and 3 in 15CF-281 and plead to count 2 in 15CF-193.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.
No victim is present on these cases.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Atty Kryshak concurs.
Defendant concurs.

Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-193 Count 2: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-281 Count 2: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-281 Count 3: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Kryshak for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-193 Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-193 Count 2: Theft
15CF-281 Count 1: Dismissed and  Read In
15CF-281 Count 2: Theft
15CF-281 Count 3: Criminal Damage to Property

Parties wish to go to sentencing.
Court notes that Court received a number of notes/correspondence as stated on the record. 
State received a copy of these letters.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation.
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court addresses the parties, will follow recommendations of the parties.

BY THE COURT:
15CF-193:
Count 2:
Jail sentence for 180 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Pay Restitution claimed in this matter, to be held open for 30 days. Requests are to be made available to counsel to contest amount
No contact with any of the victims in this matter: J.F. and M.H. except to write a letter of apology to each individual
Obtain counseling and other assessments as recommended by the agent
Pay court costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Submit to DNA Sample
Jail sentence for 30 days. Second half may be served on electronic monitoring if Defendant qualifies for the program and up to the Sheriff
Huber is granted for work, school or any other reason the Sheriff will allow
60 days to start sentence, report to jail today for start time
Perform 50 Hours of Community Service

15CF-281:
Count 2:
Jail sentence for 180 Days, Imposed and Stayed, Concurrent to 15CF-193
Probation for a period of 24 Months, Concurrent to 15CF-193
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 15CF-193
Pay costs

Count 3:
Jail sentence for 180 Days, Imposed and Stayed, Concurrent to Count 2 and 15CF-193 
Probation for a period of 24 Months, Concurrent to Count 2 and 15CF-193
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 2 and 15CF-193
Pay costs
